1e:T5b7,{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"FAQPage","mainEntity":[{"@type":"Question","name":"Do South Africans need a visa for Argentina?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"No for tourism - South Africans get 90 days visa-free. For working holiday (ages 18-30), apply in advance. For work, you'll need a work visa."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"What is the working holiday visa?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"A special agreement allowing South Africans aged 18-30 to work and travel in Argentina for up to 12 months. You can work for any employer and it's renewable in some cases."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"Can South Africans retire in Argentina?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"Yes! Argentina's retirement visa requires proof of stable passive income (pension, investments, rental income). Many South Africans choose coastal areas like Mar del Plata."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"Is there a South African community in Argentina?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"Yes, approximately 2,000-3,000 South Africans live in Argentina, concentrated in Buenos Aires, Mar del Plata, and Bariloche. Facebook groups provide excellent support."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"How long until permanent residency?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"After 2 years of temporary residency (working holiday can convert to temporary), you can apply for permanent residency, leading to citizenship after 2 more years."}}]}16:[["$","script",null,{"type":"application/ld+json","dangerouslySetInnerHTML":{"__html":"$1e"}}],["$","script",null,{"type":"application/ld+json","dangerouslySetInnerHTML":{"__html":"{\"@context\":\"https://schema.org\",\"@type\":\"BreadcrumbList\",\"itemListElement\":[{\"@type\":\"ListItem\",\"position\":1,\"name\":\"Home\",\"item\":\"https://expatsargentina.com\"},{\"@type\":\"ListItem\",\"position\":2,\"name\":\"Nationalities\",\"item\":\"https://expatsargentina.com/nationality\"},{\"@type\":\"ListItem\",\"position\":3,\"name\":\"South
